page.title: 06Changes in Clacton
page.content: We made a study of the one kilometre square around our school. First we made a study of how many roads were built over a period of {fourteen}years, from{1971}to{1985}by using three{ordnance survey maps.}We found out that in{1971}there were only {twelve}roads in the area, now, in 1985 there are{sixty nine,}this makes a total of{fifty seven}roads built in {fourteen}years, which is an average of about{four}roads a year. The kilometre square has a lot of building going on on both sides of{St. {Johns Road}which runs through the middle. Probably the best reason for coming to live in Clacton is the quietness of the roads and the main line station to London. Another reason is the sea air and the extra{ozone. Clacton is a warm place and there is not much{pollution.
